description: This course will investigate all facets of the body (literally and figuratively) within the context of fine art photography, historical and contemporary. The Nude, one of the most explored genres within the history of the medium, is subject matter that is both incredibly challenging and highly problematic for the contemporary artist. Throughout the semester, the class will examine and explore the historical, political, theoretical, aesthetic and conceptual aspects of this genre in order to feel equipped and empowered to potentially add something new, something fresh to the history of this provocative subject. This course will include various technical demonstrations , field trips, innovative assignments, and slide presentations on the history of the nude in photography as well as in depths exploration of current trends. Along with various individual projects assigned throughoutthe semester, students will be working on a final portfolio which will demonstrate their own unique perspective on this subject.
name: PHOTOGRAPHING THE NUDE
